It was called that - "Kievan Rus", in another way - "the mother of Russian cities". Your attempt to designate Ukraine as an independent state in the past is unsuccessful.

@iryna_prs @steynclan @chipfranklin The war had no effect on stability. The Russians have a former life, many foreign companies have not left us, and the inflation rate is not higher than in the US now. Only a few items have gone up in price. All this allows us not to feel the war
@iryna_prs @steynclan @chipfranklin The percentage of emigrants is very small, less than 0.1% of 150 million. This is a drop in the ocean, the bulk of the population remains in Russia

@iryna_prs @steynclan @chipfranklin Chechnya now lives in harmony. I'm afraid that if we let it go, it won't go anywhere. Putin has changed everything in Russia. Chechnya has long been loyal to Russia

@iryna_prs @steynclan @chipfranklin The US is a bad example. First, the territory of the United States is half the size of Russia. Secondly, the United States has never had a monarchy and legalized slavery in relation to its citizens.

@iryna_prs @steynclan @chipfranklin In addition, the whole history of Russia is filled with revolutions, uprisings, changes, blood, economic collapse, poverty, wars, etc. People are tired, they want stability. Putin is the first person in the history of Russia who gave us at least some stability, so we endure.

@iryna_prs @steynclan @chipfranklin Above all, Russia is the largest country in the world with 190 indigenous nationalities. In English, it's just customary to say "Russian", but we have big differences. And to keep such a diversity of territories, religions and nations, democracy is not suitable here.

@iryna_prs @steynclan @chipfranklin Everything is much deeper here. At the moment when Europe abandoned slavery, there was still legalized ownership of people in Russia. We got rid of slavery almost as recently as 1917. There is a saying in Russia: "Russia is 100 years behind Europe."

@iryna_prs @steynclan @chipfranklin Electing? Don't make me laugh, in Russia the people don't choose anything. In fact, we always "choose" the president recommended by the previous president. In fact, we have an unspoken monarchy. And our government doesn't decide anything, only the president decides.
@chipfranklin Such hostile actions give Putin even more support from the people, which allow him to justify any of his actions.

@chipfranklin Why should Putin feel something? This money is collected from taxes and the national wealth of ordinary citizens. In essence, you are stealing our money, which we have entrusted as an investment for your economy. By doing this, you only anger ordinary citizens, not Putin
